entry.content:
Here we'll discuss using conda environments, and installing a package in developer mode so you can edit it and immediately have the changes propagated. A good discussion is here.

Start a new conda environment

Create a new environment:

conda create --name myenv
conda activate /path/to/myenv

Download cw_search_manager code from github

See here for a discussion of using on your computers and ssh keys and such.

git clone https://git.ligo.org/unimelb/cw_search_manager.git
cd cw_search_manager
pip install -e .

Note that the pip install -e . runs python setup.py --install and the -e flag means it is in "developer" mode. Instead of copying the code to your site-packages it points your python path to this directory so that any changes you make are automatically propagated to your conda environment. This can be dangerous in general, but is quite useful when developing code.

entry.content:
• It's located here. Click log in with shibboleth instead of trying to log in immediately with your credentials. That will take you to a typical ligo login page.
  • To clone a repository to your computer or to the cluster you'll need to add an ssh key. See below for instructions.

Generating and using an SSH key

  • Click on the icon in the very top right (with a small dropdown arrow next to it) -> settings -> SSH keys
  • Add an SSH key or follow the instructions on how to generate one and then add it to this website. The instructions are here

Fork and Pull

  • Generally we use the fork/pull method
    • Click "fork" on the repository you want to use
    • This will create a version on your own account
    • Clone your version, make edits and commits to that version
    • Then submit a pull request with my version. I will review it and either make some changes to it, ask you to make changes, or accept it.
